docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Explosives
docs.desc: Explosive pose the player a significant threat in most puzzles. They deal the most immediate damage of any traps in the game, and you'll seriously regret hitting one. We'll show you two type today, the mine and the bomb. Just so you know, neither of these traps will hurt you if you walk over them again. Try to make it out alive!

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Putting It All Together
docs.desc: You've gone through all the tutorials and now you know how all the tiles work. This puzzle takes all the tiles you've seen so far and combines them into one. If you need a refresher on how a tile works, be sure to check out the tile reference (in About). Good luck!

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Fire and Water
docs.desc: In this tutorial, we'll be looking at the fire trap, which deals initial damage, but then also keeps dealing damage every step you take after that. The only way to make it stop is to step in water (which carrys no effects other than putting out fire). We've also added a rock, which serves to block the player without dealing damage. Have fun swimmming!

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Lava
docs.desc: The second tutorial is simple and focuses on a single tile, lava. Information about its effects (and all the new tiles in every tutorial) can be found below. Try to complete the puzzle without touching it. Or don't. You'll probably burn alive.

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Locks and Keys
docs.desc: This tutorial aims to show you how to use locks and keys. Locks are used to block movement to a certain part of the map until the color coded key is found. Once the key is found, it will unlock the lock and allow you to pass through it. Check it out below!

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: More Damage Over Time
docs.desc: This tutorial shows some more damage over time puzzles, as well as showing a healing tile. The poison trap acts almost just like the fire trap except it only triggers once, and can be cured by the mushroom. The mushroom is a one time use tile, and gives you a 10 hp boost (in addition to curing you if you're poisoned). The last damage over time trap is the deadfall trap. It deals more damage up front, and makes you bleed. There's no way to stop bleeding one you start, so you better get to the finish quick!

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Moving
docs.desc: Welcome to the first tutorial! The goal is this puzzle is to teach you how to move in the game and get you started. You are represented by the red outlined square below. To move, simply click on an adjacent tile (no diagonals allows), or use the arrow keys to move. The objective is to get to the exit in the top right. Good luck!

docs.title: Tutorial Puzzle: Sharp Things
docs.desc: This tutorial will teach you about the sharp things in the game. There are three types that you'll see. The spike, the nail, and the cactus. Unlike explosives, these will deal damage every time you walk over them, so avoid backtracking, and try not to get poked to death!
